name: havn
description: A fast configurable port scanner with reasonable defaults
readme_summary: havn is a fast and configurable port scanner written in Rust, utilizing asynchronous Tokio multithreading for efficient scanning. It offers reasonable defaults and configurable options, making it suitable for various scanning needs across multiple platforms, including Docker.
primary_use_case: Network port scanning for identifying open ports on a target address or IP.
cover_image_prompt: A seasoned cartographer meticulously charting the ports of a bustling harbor city with a glowing, hand-held scanner. The scanner emits beams of light, illuminating open ports on ships and docks, marking them on a digital map projected onto a nearby screen. Small data packets swirl around the cartographer, visualizing the flow of network traffic. The city skyline is subtly rendered with binary code patterns. The scene is set at twilight, casting long shadows and highlighting the scanner's glow. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and sharp details.

name: autocomplete
description: ðŸ”® Fast and full-featured autocomplete library
readme_summary: The `autocomplete` library is a JavaScript library designed to enable developers to quickly build autocomplete experiences in their applications. It provides the core functionality for handling user input, fetching suggestions from various data sources, and rendering the autocomplete UI, while giving developers full control over the DOM elements used for output.
key_features: Support for various data sources (static, Algolia, recent searches)
Two packages available: autocomplete-js (complete) and autocomplete-core (for custom renderers)
primary_use_case: Implementing autocomplete functionality in web applications.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled calligrapher sits at a desk, carefully writing words with a magical quill that anticipates the next word as it touches the parchment. Above the parchment, faint, glowing suggestions appear, branching out from the quill's tip like shimmering constellations. Small UI elements float around the calligrapher, displaying search queries and dropdown menus. The scene is set in a cozy, well-lit study filled with books and scrolls. The composition is focused and clean, with a warm color scheme. The image should be in a flat design style with clear iconography and subtle digital enhancements.

name: maildrop
description: âœ‰ï¸ A self hostable disposable email service
readme_summary: Maildrop is a self-hostable, open-source disposable email service. It allows users to receive emails at randomly generated addresses on their own domain, which is useful for signing up for services without revealing a personal email address or creating multiple accounts.
primary_use_case: Receiving emails on a disposable address for privacy and convenience.
cover_image_prompt: A friendly mailman wearing a futuristic visor sorts letters into color-coded mailboxes, each labeled with a different website logo. Some mailboxes glow with a faint digital aura, indicating active use. The mailman uses a device that generates random alphanumeric strings, which he affixes to new mailboxes. A small screen in the background displays a simplified UI of the Maildrop application. The scene is set in a clean, modern postal facility with bright, inviting lighting. The image should be in a flat design style with clear iconography and a pastel color scheme.

name: howdy
description: ðŸ›¡ï¸ Windows Helloâ„¢ style facial authentication for Linux
readme_summary: Howdy provides Windows Hello-style facial authentication for Linux systems. It leverages IR emitters and cameras for facial recognition, enabling password-free authentication for login, screen lock, sudo, and other PAM-integrated functions.
key_features: Support for multiple Linux distributions (Ubuntu, Debian, Arch Linux, Fedora, openSUSE)
primary_use_case: Password-free authentication on Linux systems using facial recognition.
cover_image_prompt: A friendly robot doorman, with glowing IR sensors for eyes, unlocking a Linux desktop with a smile upon recognizing the user's face. The desktop displays a welcome message and subtle system information. The robot stands in a brightly lit, modern office setting with digital particles swirling around its head, representing facial data. A small screen on the robot's chest displays the Howdy logo. The scene is in a 3D isometric illustration style with clean lines, vibrant colors, and a focus on clarity and approachability.

name: DiffMem
description: Git Based Memory Storage for Conversational AI Agent
readme_summary: DiffMem is a Git-based memory backend for AI agents and conversational systems. It leverages Git for version control and Markdown files for human-readable storage, enabling efficient tracking and retrieval of information. The system uses an in-memory BM25 index for fast, explainable search, making it suitable for long-horizon AI applications where memories evolve over time.
key_features: In-memory BM25 index for fast retrieval
Differential intelligence using Git diffs and logs
Clear separation of current state and historical data
Writer Agent for analyzing conversations and committing updates
Context Manager for assembling query-relevant context at varying depths
Searcher Agent for LLM-orchestrated BM25 search
primary_use_case: Long-term memory storage and retrieval for AI agents, particularly in conversational systems, where the ability to track and query the evolution of information is important.
cover_image_prompt: A librarian meticulously archiving memories in a vast library where each book represents a moment or fact. The librarian uses a special 'Git' indexing system to track changes and versions of each memory, symbolized by glowing threads connecting different editions of the books. A magnifying glass reveals the 'diffs' between versions. UI elements float around the scene, showing code snippets and data visualizations of memory evolution. The scene is set in a grand, futuristic library with warm, inviting lighting. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: blender-mcp
readme_summary: BlenderMCP connects Blender to Claude AI, enabling prompt-assisted 3D modeling, scene creation, and manipulation through the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It allows Claude to directly interact with and control Blender, facilitating tasks like object manipulation, material control, and scene inspection via a socket-based server.
key_features: Two-way communication between Claude AI and Blender
Material control (apply and modify materials and colors)
Code execution (run arbitrary Python code from Claude)
primary_use_case: Enabling Claude AI to control and interact with Blender for 3D modeling and scene creation tasks.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled artisan sculpting a digital clay model within Blender, guided by a spectral Claude AI assistant hovering nearby, offering suggestions and adjustments. The artisan's hands manipulate the model, while the AI displays code snippets and material options on translucent screens. The scene is set in a bright, modern studio with subtle digital particles swirling around the model. Small UI elements showing Blender's interface are subtly incorporated. The composition is clean and focused with a vibrant color scheme. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.
